error.signature: TypeError: dispatch is not a function
error.regex: dispatch is not a function|useReducer.*dispatch.*undefined|reducer.*action.*type.*undefined|Cannot read propert.*dispatch

verdict.summary: useReducer dispatch function is undefined or not a function. Usually caused by destructuring useReducer return incorrectly, using dispatch from a Context that has no Provider, or passing dispatch to a child that receives it as a different prop name.

dead_ends.action: Wrap dispatch calls in a try-catch to suppress the error
dead_ends.why_fails: The state update is silently lost; the UI becomes stale and unresponsive. The root cause (missing dispatch reference) is not addressed.

dead_ends.action: Replace useReducer with multiple useState calls
dead_ends.why_fails: Loses the benefits of a reducer pattern (centralized state logic, action-based updates). Does not fix the structural issue of how dispatch is passed around.

workarounds.action: Verify useReducer destructuring: const [state, dispatch] = useReducer(reducer, initialState)
workarounds.how: Ensure the return value is destructured correctly. Common mistake: const [dispatch, state] = useReducer(...) (swapped order).

workarounds.action: When using dispatch from Context, ensure the Provider passes dispatch and is an ancestor of the consumer
workarounds.how: const DispatchContext = createContext(null); function App() { const [state, dispatch] = useReducer(reducer, init); return <DispatchContext.Provider value={dispatch}><Child /></DispatchContext.Provider>; }
workarounds.condition: When dispatch is shared via Context

leads_to.condition: When dispatch comes from a Context and the Provider is missing from the component tree

preceded_by.condition: When migrating from useState to useReducer with Context and forgetting to add the dispatch Provider

frequently_confused_with.distinction: reducer-dispatch-error is about dispatch being undefined or inaccessible, while bad-setstate-in-render is about calling state updates at the wrong time (during render)
